Name: Apple Dumplings - Danish Style
Instructions:
Mix the first 4 ingredients as you would for a pie;  add about 1/2 cup milk to make dough soft.  Roll out on floured pastry cloth to about 12" x 18".  Slice 1 qt. apples and place in center of dough.  Sprinkle apples with 1/2 cup sugar mixed with 1 teaspoon cinnamon.  Dot with 2 tablespoons butter.  Fold dough over apples and seal as best you can.  Place in a 9" x 13" pan and pour on white sauce.  

White Sauce

Combine the 1/2 cup sugar, 1 cup water, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1 tablespoon flour, and 1 teaspoon butter.  Cook and pour over pastry.

Bake 3/4 of an hour at 375 degrees.  (It usually takes longer)

Note:  I make 1 1/2 recipes of the pastry and double the white sauce.

Name: Apple Pecan Loaf
Instructions:
Combine apples, pecans, and 2 cups sugar in mixing bowl and let stand 1 hour.  Stir often so mixture makes its own juice.  Preheat oven to 325 degrees.  Mix together flour, nutmeg, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, allspice, salt, and baking soda, and add to apple mixture.  Combine well (Best done with hands).

Melt butter and add vanilla.  Add butter mixture and eggs to apple mixture.  Combine well, using hands.  Grease 5 x 9 x 2 3/4 in. loaf pan with vegetable oil and line with wax paper.  Grease again.  Pour batter into pan and bake 1 1/2 hours.

Mix remaining 2 teaspoons sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon and dust over top of loaf 30 minutes before baking time has elapsed.  Remove from oven and cool 45 minutes in pan.  Remove loaf from pan and cool another 90 minutes.  Slice and serve.  Makes 12 or more servings.

Note:  Use 1 large bread pan or 2 medium pans.

Name: Apple-Apricot Crostata
Instructions:
Grease 10 inch fluted tart pan with a removable bottom.

Peel, core, and slice apples into crescents about 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick.  You should have about 24 pieces.

Put sugar, butter, egg yolks, flour and salt in large bowl and rub everything together with your fingers or combine ingredients in food processor fitted with steel blade and process in quick pulses until dough forms a ball.  Either way, do not over work dough.

With a spatula, spread dough evenly around pan and up the sides.  The dough should be about 1/2 inch thick up the sides and evenly spread across the bottom of the pan.  Trim and flatten edges with a knife.

Starting on the outside and working toward the center, lay apple slices in overlapping, concentric circles.

Heat apricot preserves in sauce pan over low heat until liquefied.  Using a pastry brush, paint apples and visible crust with apricot glaze.

Place tart pan on cookie sheet and bake on center rack of preheated 425 degree oven 15 minutes.  Reduce oven to 350 degrees and continue baking until crust is deep golden brown, about 45 minutes.


Note:  I used regular butter.

Name: Artichoke Antipasto Salad
Instructions:
Toss the first 5 ingredients together.  Chill for 30 minutes.  Wash and tear lettuce into bite size pieces.  Just before serving, combine all ingredients.

Optional:  Slivered avacado, fresh basil

Note:  If marinade isn't tasty enough, you can add Caesar or Italian dressing to give it more zip.  The imported marinated artichokes are usually more tasty.
Description: A really tasty, easy to make salad.

Name: Artichoke Dip
Instructions:
Drain and coarsely chop artichokes.  Set aside.  In mixing bowl, combine Parmesan, mozzarella and mayonnaise, stirring well to blend.  Add garlic salt and stir well.  Fold in chopped artichokes.  Spoon into a 1 1/2 qt. casserole.  Sprinkle parsley on top.  Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes until golden brown.  Serve with crackers.  Makes 3 1/2 to 4 cups.

Note:  It is tastier if you use Kraft parmesan cheese instead of freshly grated.

Name: Baked Manicotti (Manicotti)
Instructions:
Meat Sauce: 1. Adjust oven rack to upper middle position and heat oven to 375 degrees. Pulse onion and pepperoni in food processor until coarsely ground, about 10 pulses. Add beef and pulse until thoroughly combined, 5 to 8 pulses. 2. Transfer mixture to large saucepan and cook over medium heat, breaking up mixture with wooden spoon, until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Using slotted spoon, transfer 1 cup meat mixture to paper towel-lined plate and reserve. Add garlic, tomato paste, and pepper flakes to pot and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes and simmer until sauce is slightly thickened, about 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. (Meat sauce can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.)
3. For the Manicotti: Combine ricotta, 2 cups mozzarella, 1 cup provolone, egg, basil, salt, pepper, and reserved meat mixture in large bowl. Pour 1 inch boiling water into 13 by 9-inch baking dish and slip noodels into water, one at a time. Let noodles soak until pliable, about 5 minutes, separating noodles with tip of knife to prevent sticking. Remove noodles from water and place in single layer on clean dish towels; discard water and dry off baking dish.
4. Spread half of meat sauce over bottom of baking dish. Spread 1/4 cup ricotta mixture evenly over bottom of each noodle. Roll noodles up around filling and lay them seam side down in baking dish. Spread remaining sauce over top to cover pasta completely. Cover dish tightly with aluminum foil and bak until bubbling around edges, about 40 minutes. Remove foili and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella and 1/2 cup provolone. Bake until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Let cool for 15 minutes. Serve.
Description: You will need 16 no-boil lasagna noodles for this recipe. The test kitchen's preferred brand, Barilla, comes 16 noodles to a box, but other brands contain only 12. It is important to let the dish cool for 15 minutes after baking.

Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Spray cooking oil (you can use butter, too) to coat the bottom of a 9x5x3 inch bread pan, then lightly dust the pan with flour and tap out the excess.

In a large bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

In another bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until blended.  One at a time, add eggs, beating well with a fork after each addition.  Stir in bananas, milk, and vanilla until combined.  Stir in flour mixture just until blended.  Stir in the chocolate chips.  

Scrape batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.  Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until you test with a knife in the center of the bread and it comes out clean.

Remove the pan to a wire rack.  Cool 10 minutes before removing bread from the pan.  Finish cooling on the rack.
Name: Banana Chocolate Chip Bread

Description: A tasty salad that is easy to make.
Instructions: In a 3 quart bowl, combine olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.  Add the vegetables.  Stir and chill.
Name: Bean and Corn Salad

Instructions: Cut beef into strips and brown in oil.  Add onion and green pepper.  Add celery and green beans.  Cook 3 to 5 minutes.  Combine cornstarch with soy sauce and 1 cup water.  Add to skillet.  Stir in mushrooms.  Cook 5 minutes, stirring until liquid is clear.  Salt to taste.
Name: Beef Skillet
Description: Simple beef dish with vegetables.

Ingredients.Name: Large Garlic Cloves (Unpeeled) (I Use One or Two)

Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.  Arrange beef bones in large roasting pan.  Bake until browned, turning occasionally, about 30 minutes.  Add onions and carrots and cook until browned - 30 minutes.

Using slotted spoon, transfer bones, onions and carrots to stock pot.  Pour off drippings from pan.  Set pan over high heat.  Add 1 cup water and bring to boil, scraping up brown bits.  Add to pot.  Add celery, bay leaves, parsely, and garlic.  Pour enough water in to cover ingredients.  Add peppercorns and thyme. Cover partially.  Simmer 8 hours.

Note:  Try 2 cups red wine to deglaze pan and add to stock pot with 8 cups water.
Name: Beef Stock
Beef Stroganoff
Instructions:
Trim fat from beef.  Cut crosswise into 1/2 inch thick slices.  Cut each slice across grain into 1/2 inch wide strips.  Slowly heat large heavy skillet.  In it, melt 2 tablespoons butter.  Add just enough beef strips to cover the bottom.  Over high heat, sear quickly on all sides.  With tongs, remove beef as it browns.  (Should be browned outside, rare inside.)  Brown the rest of the beef.  Set aside.  Add remaining butter, saute mushrooms and onion until golden.   Remove from heat.  Add flour, garlic, Kitchen Bouquet, ketchup, salt and pepper.  Stir until smooth.  Gradually add broth and bring to a boil, stirring.  Reduce heat, simmer 5 minutes.  Over low heat, add wine and sour cream, stirring until well combined.  Add beef;  simmer until sauce and beef are hot.  Serve with cooked noodles.  

Note:  I use Campbell's beef broth

Ingredients.Name: Dry White Wine (I Use Red or White)
Frozen Chopped Spinach, Thawed and Squeezed Dry

Name: Beef and Spinach Lasagna
Instructions:
1. In a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Stir in the spaghetti sauce, garlic, basil and oregano. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 10 minutes. In a large bowl, combine the spinach, ricotta and 1 cup mozzarella cheese.
2. Spread 1-1/2 cups meat sauce into a greased 12-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Top with three noodles. Spread 1-1/2 cups sauce to edges of noodles. Top with half of the spinach mixture. Repeat layers. Top with the remaining noodels, sauce and mozzarella cheese. 
3. Cover and bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Uncover; bake 10-15 minutes longer or until bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting. 
Yields 12 servings.
Note: Add mozzarella cheese to each layer. Add fresh parmesan cheese to spinach mixture to each layer. Tim suggests more ricotta cheese.

Season chicken with salt and pepper;  dust lightly with flour.  Saute in butter over medium high heat until lightly browned on both sides.  Add vegetables and brandy.  Remove from heat and carefully ignite brandy.  Put back on burner.  When flame subsides, cover immediately and remove from heat.  Let rest, covered, 5 minutes.

Place chicken on plate.  Arrange vegetables over chicken.    Top with sauce from pan.

Makes 1 serving
Name: Beer Baron's Chicken Vesuvio

Description: Sassy!
Instructions: Mix and match and sassiness awaits!
Name: Ben's Sassy Indian Dressing
Black Bean Avocado Salsa
Description:
This is great used as a dip, or on top of chicken or fish. 

It tastes better if you let it sit in the fridge for a few to several hours before you serve.

Enjoy!
Instructions: Mix in a bowl and refrigerate. Makes 3+ cups.

Ingredients.Name: Instant Chocolate Pudding and Pie Filling

Instructions:
Mix all ingredients in large mixing bowl at low speed for one minute.  Then beat at medium speed for 4 minutes.  Pour into greased and floured 10 inch bundt pan.

Bake at 350 degrees for 60 to 70 minutes.

Cool in pan for 10 minutes.  Invert onto rack.  Poke holes into cake with a fork and brush glaze over entire cake.

Glaze:  Blend the powdered sugar and 1/4 cup Kahlua until smooth.
Name: Black Russian Chocolate Bundt Cake

Instructions:
Saute the shallot, onion, and carrots in the butter.  Add the flour and brown lightly.  Add the beef broth, whole peppers, clove, bay leaf, and simmer until thick, about 10 minutes.  Strain and then add salt, pepper, wine, and parsley.  Can be made the day before and reheated.  Freeze left over sauce.

Serves:  6 - 8
Description: Really great on beef tenderloin!
Name: Bordelaise Sauce
BreadSmith Pizza Dough Instructions
Instructions: Remove dough from the refrigerator.  Place on work surface covered with cornmeal or flour.  Allow dough to return to room temperature.  Shape dough, then add pizza sauce and toppings.  For best results bake on a pizza stone or sheet pan.  Preheat oven to 425 degrees.  Bake 18 to 25 minutes.  Allow to cool 5 minutes before slicing.
Description: Instructions for using pizza dough purchased from BreadSmith.

Name: Broccoli Salad
Instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients (salad).  Combine last three ingredients (dressing).  Pour dressing over the salad.  Chill.

Name: California Sandwich
Instructions: Make as a panini.

Name: Certo Remake Directions for Cooked Jam or Jelly
Instructions:
1.  Prepare Jars

2.  Boil a jar on rack in large pot filled with water 10 minutes.  Place a flat lid in saucepan with water.  Bring to boil.  Remove from heat.  Let jar and lid stand in hot water until ready to fill with Trial Batch.  Drain well before filling.  Repeat this procedure with jars needed for remmainder of batch.

3.  Prepare Trial Batch

    Measure jam or jelly (1 cup) into small (1 quart) saucepan.  Bring mixture to full rolling boil (a boil that doesn't stop bubbling when stirred) on high heat, stirring constantly.  Stir in above amounts of sugar, lemon juice, and Certo Fruit Pectin.  Return to full rolling boil on high heat, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Skim off any foam with metal spoon.

   Quickly pour into prepared jar.  Cover and let stand up to 24 hours to check set of Trial Batch.

   Store opened pouch of Certo Fruit Pectin in refrigerator.

5.  Prepare remainder of batch.

6.  Do not try to remake more that 8 cups of jam or jelly at one time.  If Trial Batch sets satisfactorily, follow recipe above, using the listed measures of sugar, lemon juice and Certo Fruit Pectin for EACH 1 cup of jam or jelly.  Measure jam or jelly into a large (6 to 8 quart) saucepot.  Bring to full rolling boil as directed; continue to boil 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Skim off any foam with metal spoon.  

Ladle quickly into prepared jars, filling to within 1/8 inch of tops.  Wipe jar rims and threads.  Cover with two-piece lids.  Screw bands tightly.  Invert jars 5 minutes, then turn upright.  Or follow water bath method recommended by USDA.  After jars are cool, check seals.

After preparing remainder of batch, discard Certo Fruit Pectin in opened pouch.

7.  For convenience in measuring larger amounts of sugar, lemon juice, and Certo:

3   Teaspoons   =  1 Tablespoon
8   Tablespoons =  1/2 cup
16  Tablespoons = 1 cup


Remember:  If your jam or jelly still doesn't set, you can always use it as a glaze or syrup!
Description: Instructions for jam and jelly that didn't gel.

Name: Chicken Chimi in the Oven
Instructions:
1.  Saute onion and garlic in a large saucepan until tender.  Stir in chili powder, salsa, water, cumin and cinnamon.  Mix together and pour mixture into blender or food processor;  process until smooth.  Pour back into saucepan and stir in chicken.  Heat through.

2.  Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

3.  Spoon a heaping tablespoon of beans down center of each tortilla, working with 1 tortilla at a time.  Top with 1/2 cup of chicken mixture.  Fold up bottom, top and sides of tortillas and secure with toothpicks.  Place chimichangas seam-side-down in a lightly greased 10x15 inch baking dish.  Brush sides with oil.

4.  Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown and crisp, turning every five munutes.  Serve with salsa, sour cream, and guacamole.

Note:  My Recipe Adjustments:

1.  I place boneless, skinless chicken breasts in a pan and sprinkle them with salt, pepper, and chili powder.  I bake them at 350 degrees until cooked through.

2.  In the chicken mixture (see # 1 of original recipe) I use 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons chili powder, and 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon.

3.  I add shredded cheddar cheese along with the beans and shredded chicken mixture in the flour tortillas.
Description: A fragrant, spicy chicken mixture rolled up in flour tortillas and baked.  A healthy version of a chicken chimichanga.
A fajita recipe from the kitchen of Mom.
Name: Chicken Fajitas
Instructions:
Cut chicken into 1/4" strips. Slice onion into rings. Cut bell peppers into strips. Mince garlic cloves.

1. Make the marinade for the chicken.

Pour the lime juice, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, and vinegar into a shallow bowl. Add minced garlic cloves, tabasco, cumin, salt and pepper. Mix the marinade together and add the chicken strips. Cover and marinate for at least 2 hours in the refridgerator, stirring occasionally.

2. Wrap the tortillas in foil. Warm in 300 deg. oven for 15 minutes. Heat olive oil in large nonstick skillet. Add chicken (throw marinade away). Add onion and bell peppers. Saute for about 10 minutes or until chicken is done. 

Serve with chedder cheese, salsa, tomatoes, sour cream, and guacamole -- if you have it.

Name: Chicken Freddy
Instructions:
Saute onion and pepper in 1/2 cup butter. Add crushed garlic and cook about 5 minutes over low heat, or until vegetables are limp. With slotted spoon, remove onion, pepper, and garlic from butter and reserver.

Add remaining butter. Brown chicken breasts in butter; replace onion, pepper, and garlic. Add wine, tomato sauce, basil, oregano, salt and pepper. Cover and cook for about 30-45 minutes or until chicken is tender.

Just before serving, cover chicken with mozzarella cheese strips and serve when cheese is melted.

1 billion calories per serving. For a slightly healthier version use olive oil. It won't have the same flavor though! (I usually do half and half -- you don't need as much olive oil to replace the butter).
Description: A wonderfully fatty, oily, garlicy, tasty chicken dish.

Name: Chicken Jambalaya
Instructions:
Cut Chicken meat into 3/4 inch cubes.  In a 6 quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons oil and saute chicken until light brown (about 10 minutes); remove and set aside.

Cut sausage into large 2 1/2 inch pieces.  In the same Dutch oven over medium heat, saute sausage until lightly browned (about 10 minutes).  Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.

In remaining oil over medium heat, saute onions, celery, carrot, bell pepper and garlic until golden brown (about 10 to 12 minutes).  Stir in flour and cook until light brown (about 10 minutes).  Stir in tomatoes.  Season with thyme, and add cayenne, salt, and pepper to taste.

Add chicken broth; bring to a boil over medium-high heat and add rice and chicken.  Reduce heat to simmer and cook, covered, until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender (about 20 minutes).

Stir in reserved sausage and cook 15 minutes more; taste, adjusting seasonings if necessary.  Garnish with parsley; serve hot.

Makes 8 servings.



Note

1.  I cut the recipe in half.
2.  I used a scant 1/2 teaspoon cayenne.  It needed more.
3.  I used 1/2 teaspoon ground, dried thyme.  
4.  I used 1 teaspoon black pepper.
5.  Additional chicken stock may be needed so that the jambalaya doesn't get gummy.

Name: Chicken Spiedies
Instructions:
1. Mix the oil, garlic, basil, oregano, lemon zest, salst, pepper and pepper flakes in a large bowl.
2. Take the 2 T of the oil mixture and place into another bowl and set aside.
3. Pick the checken breasts with a fork all over on each side. Cut into 1 1/4 in. chunks. Add to large (first) bowl of marinade. Refrigerate and marinate for at least 30 minutes and no longer than 3 hours. 
4. Whisk together mayo, vinegar and lemon juice with the 2 Tbsp of oil mixture set aside earlier.
5. Remove the chicken and thread onto metal skewers. 
6. Heat your grill for 10 minutes on high.
7. Clean and oil your cooking grate. Place the skewers on the grill, turning frequently. Cook for 10-15 minutes. 
8. Remove from grill and allow chicken to rest for at least 5 minutes.
9. Grill the rolls on grill for a few seconds each. Remove quickly or they will burn.
10. Remove the chicken from the skewers directly on the rolls. Drizzle with mayo sauce mixture.
Note: Double sauces for more than 6 sandwiches.
Description: Chicken sandwiches assembled with skewers.

Instructions:
Dust chicken with flour, salt, and pepper.  Cook chicken in butter until brown on both sides.  Remove and set aside.

In skillet combine cranberries, water, brown sugar, vinegar and nutmeg.  Simmer for 5 minutes.  Place chicken on top.  Cover and simmer for 30 minutes.

To serve:  Spoon cranberries over chicken.

Serves 6
Name: Chicken With Cranberries

Instructions:
Cook noodles according to package directions.  Meanwhile, rinse and cut chicken into bite size pieces.  Heat oil in skillet.  Add chicken.  Salt and pepper the chicken.  Cook chicken until browned lightly.

Add onions, garlic, and spices.  Cook and stir for 30 seconds.  Add tomatoes and wine.  Bring to a boil over high heat.  Simmer until chicken and sauce are heated through.  Add olives and stir.

Toss sauce with hot noodles and serve, arranging chicken pieces on top of the noodles.  

Serves 4
Name: Chicken and Olives

Description: Great onion-y, leek-y chicken dish.
Name: Chicken breasts dijon
Instructions:
Step 1 - Heat oil in a large heavy Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Place chicken in Dutch oven and cook until brown on both sides, 12-15 minutes total. Transfer to a plate and set aside.

Step 2 - Place leeks and onion in same pot and sauté until tender, about 8 minutes. Add garlic and sauté until tender, about 2 minutes. Stir in broth, wine, Dijon mustard, and minced thyme and bring to a simmer. Return chicken to pot. Cover and simmer over medium-low heat until chicken is cooked through, about 15 minutes.

Step 3 - Transfer chicken to plates. Bring liquid in pot to a boil; cook until sauce is thickened and glossy, about 15 minutes. Whisk in butter and season with salt and pepper. Spoon sauce over chicken and garnish with thyme leaves.

Ingredients.Name: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

Name: Chinese Pork & Rice
Instructions:
Saute rice in oil in a skillet until lightly brown.  Watch closely to avoid burning.

Add water, bouillion cube, soy sauce and salt.  Cover and cook 5 minutes.

Gently mix vegetables and pork throughout rice mixture.  Cook covered until the rice is cooked and the vegetables are tender. 

Note:  Other kinds of vegetables may be added.  Serve with chow mein noodles.

Name: Chocolate Fluff Frosting
Instructions:
In chilled bowl, with electric mixer or hand beater, beat 2 cups heavy cream with 1/2 cup powdered sugar, 1/2 cup Quik chocolate mix until thick enough to spread on cake.

Note:  Excellent on angel food cake.

Name: Chunky Vegetable Dip
Description: An easy to make dip that everyone likes.
Instructions:
Combine all of the ingredients, leaving the dip a bit chunky.  Chill.  Cut up vegetables such as carrots, celery, cauliflower, cucumbers, etc. and serve with the dip.

Note:  I use Heinz chili sauce and Hellmann's mayo.

Name: Corn Flake Cookies
Instructions:
Roll into balls.  Press with fork.  

Bake at 350 degrees for about 12 minutes.

Name: Cranberry Apple Cobbler
Instructions:
1.  Combine first six ingredients and let stand 5 minutes.
2.  Cook on medium heat until boiling.
3.  Pour into 2 quart dish and dot with butter.
4.  Mix dry ingredients.
5.  Cut in butter until coarse crumbs form.
6.  Stir in milk until soft dough forms.
7.  Drop by tablespoons onto hot apples.
8.  Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes.

Name: Cranberry Sauce & Relish
Instructions:
Cranberry Sauce:

Heat to boiling 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water and add 2 cups cranberries.  Cook until berries pop. Add minse meat and pecans.  Cool.  Add brandy to mixture the day it is to be served.


Cranberry Relish

Grind 2 cups cranberries and 1 seeded orange together.    Mix with 1 cup sugar.  Let stand several days before serving.  Add minse meat, pecans, and brandy the day it is to be served.


Sauce and relish can be frozen remembering to add brandy the day it is to be served.

Ingredients.Name: Sugar (This amount may not be necessary because of sugar in stock)
Whole Cranberries or 2 Cups Cranberry Stock

Instructions:
Beat together cream cheese, 1 egg, 1/3 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla until smooth.  Spread in pastry shell.  Sprinkle with pecans.

In another bowl, beat 3 eggs until frothy.  Add corn syrup, 1/4 cup sugar, salt, and 1 teaspoon vanilla.  Beat until blended.  Gently pour mixture over pecans.

Bake at 375 degrees about 40 minutes, until knife inserted halfway between center and edge comes out clean.  Place on rack to cool.
Name: Cream Cheese Pecan Pie

Instructions:
1. Add all the aromatics and chicken breasts to a pot of boiling water to poach the chicken. Once the water is simmering, turn off the flame and cover and let the chicken sit for 20-25 minutes till its cooked. Remove it from the poaching liquid and let it rest for 10 minutes before dicing or shredding it.
2. Whisk all the ingredients for the dressing in a bowl and set aside for 15 minutes. Whisk again, just before adding it to the salad.
3. In a large bowl, add all the veggies, chicken and the crunchy fried noodles. Pour the dressing and toss well. Serve immediately.
Description:
Chinese-ish salad with good flavors. 

Note: I made a dry rub for grilling: I ground a whole Anise seed pod using a mortar and pestle and I substituted oregano for the bay leaf but used the rest of the ingredients for the poached chicken. I substituted the chinese noodlles for crunchy onions. 2Tbs. of dressing, 1/2 cup chicken plus 1 1/2 cups of salad is about 300 calories. I suggest doubling the dressing as well.
Name: Crunchy Chicken Salad
Curly Pasta with Creamy Chicken Sauce
Instructions:
In a saucepan melt butter.  Add flour and stir to combine.  Add broth, a little at a time, stirring.  Bring to a boil.  Cook for about 3 minutes over medium heat.

Add chicken to creamy mixture in saucepan.  Add mustards and lemon peel.  Finally, add sour cream.

Drain pasta well.  Place on a hot serving dish.  Heat sauce over medium low heat.  Distribute evenly over hot pasta.  

Serve pasta in individual serving dishes with sauce on the side.  Sprinkle with chopped chives.

Note:  I added chili powder, tabasco sauce, and broccoli for flavor.  Other veggies could be added, too.  I also used 2 tablespoons of mustard and will try adding more next time.

Note:  With some changes, the family really liked this recipe.  I will be trying a few minor adjustments in the future.

Ingredients.Name: Chicken (Cooked, deboned, diced)  I use chicken breasts

Instructions:
1. Spread flour in shallow dish. Pound thicker ends of chicken breasts as needed to create even thickness. Pat chicken dry with paper towels and season with salt and pepper. Dredge chicken in flour to coat, shaking off excess.
2. Heat 12” cast iron skillet over medium heat for 5 min. Add 2 tablespoons oil and heat until just smoking. Brown chicken, about 4 min. per side; transfer to plate.
3. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in now empty skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add carrots, onion, and 1/2 tsp. salt and cook until softened, about 5 min. Stir in rice, garlic, and curry powder and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in broth, scraping up any browned bits, and bring to simmer.
4. Nestle chicken into skillet along with any accumulated juices. Reduce heat to gentle simmer, cover, and cook until chicken registers 160 degrees, about 8 min. Transfer chicken to serving platter, brushing any rice that sticks to chicken back into skillet, and tent loosely with aluminum foil. Let chicken rest while finishing rice.
5. Add coconut milk to skillet, cover, and cook over medium- low heat, stirring occasionally, until liquid has been absorbed and rice is tender, 12 to 15 min. Off heat, sprinkle peas over rice, cover, and let sit until heated through, about 2 min. Gently fold cilantro (optional) and almonds into rice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve chicken with rice.
Note: I added more curry and almonds.
Note: rice gets mushy if you mix too much. Tried basmati rice which worked better.
Name: Curried Chicken and Rice

Ingredients.Name: Carrots, peeled and cut into 1/4” pieces
Dark Chocolate Mousse Mix (Knorr Works Well)

Name: Death by Chocolate
Instructions:
Bake brownies as directed.  Cool.

Whip mousse as directed but add Kahlua as part of the liquid.  A glass trifle dish may be used or the 9" x 13" pan the brownies were baked in.  Remove half the brownies from pan.  Set aside.  Crumble the rest in bottom of pan or trifle dish.  Cover with half of the mousse.  Sprinkle with half of the candy bar bits then spread with half the Cool Whip.  Repeat layers once more.  Refrigerate.

This is a large dessert and can be cut in half or a third.  One whole recipe serves 15 to 18.  Can be frozen.  Uncover before thawing so Cool Whip doesn't stick to wrap.

In med. bowl, dissolve yeast and 1 teaspoon of sugar in warm water.  Let stand 5 minutes until small bubbles form on the surface.  Stir in rest of sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1 tablespoon olive oil.  Stir in flour - 1 cup at a time - to make a soft dough.

Turn dough out on lightly floured surface.  Knead until dough is smooth and elastic, about 3 minutes.  Put in greased bowl; cover and let rise in warm place until doubled, 45 to 60 minutes.  Punch dough down.  Brush bottom of 14 inch diameter, 2 inch deep, round pizza pan with remaining olive oil;  sprinkle with cornmeal.  Press dough in bottom and up sides of pan.  Rim of dough should be 1/2 inch wide.  Let rise about 20 minutes, uncovered.

Filling - form sausage into 3/4 inch balls and brown in non-stick skillet;  pour off grease;  drain sausage balls on paper towels.  Drain tomatoes thoroughly by pressing between paper towels until most of moisture is absorbed.  Coarsely chop tomatoes.

Assemble pizza - place mozzarella in dough-lined pizza pan.  Arrange sausage and tomatoes on top.  Combine oregano, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and crushed fennel seed and sprinkle over pizza.  Top with even sprinkling of parmesan cheese.  

Place pizza in oven preheated to 500 degrees;  immediately reduce to 450 degrees.  Bake 25 minutes or until crust and cheese are golden brown.  Remove from pan.
Name: Deep Dish Pizza
Double Chocolate Fantasy Bars
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350 deg. In large mixer bowl, beat cake mix, oil, and egg on medium speed until crumbly. Add nuts.  Reserving 1 1/2 cups crum mixture, press remainder firmly on bottom of greased 13x9 inch baking pan. In small sauce pan, combine remaining ingredients. Over medium heat, cook and stir until chips melt. Pour evenly over prepared crust. Top with reserved crumb mixture. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until bubbly. Cool. Cut into bars. Store loosely covered at room temperature.
Description: Not really a browny, too dense. Not really a cookie, too soft. This is one serious dessert for the chocolate nut.

Instructions:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.  Brush a 9x13 inch pan with butter.

In a large bowl, beat eggs until foamy.  Add both cans of corn.  Add melted butter, onion dip, and pepper.  Beat together.  Stir in muffin mix and blend.  Add onions.

Pour into the 9x13 inch pan and bake 45 minutes or until it tests done with a toothpick.
Name: Easter Corn Bake

Instructions:
Cut muffins into 1/2 inch cubes.  Set aside. Cut Canadian bacon into 1/2 inch squares.  Set aside.  Whisk eggs well in 2 qt. bowl.  Whisk in milk and onion powder.

Spray 9x13 inch glass or ceramic baking dish with vegetable spray.  Scatter half Canadian bacon evenly in bottom of dish.  Scatter muffin cubes on top of Canadian bacon.  Top with remaining Canadian bacon, scattering it evenly over muffin cubes.  Pour egg mixture over casserole.  Cover dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight, or at least 8 hours, to let bread absorb egg mixture.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees.

Remove casserole from refrigerator, and uncover it.  Lightly sprinkle paprika evenly over top.  Cover casserole with foil and bake 40 minutes.  

Remove dish from oven, remove foil, return dish to oven and continue to bake, uncovered, until the eggs are set and the bacon on top begins to crisp, about 20 minutes more.  Remove casserole from oven and let stand 5 minutes before serving.

To serve, cut casserole into squares and place on individual plates.  Spoon warm Hollandaise sauce over each serving just before serving.  Makes 10 servings.

Easy Hollandaise Sauce:

1/2  Cup (1 stick) Butter
4     Large Eggs
1/2  Cup Whipping Cream
2     Tablespoons Lemon Juice
1     Teaspoon Dijon Mustard

Cut butter into 4 pieces and place in 1 quart glass measure or bowl and microwave, covered with paper towel, on high, until almost melted, 45 seconds to 1 minute.  Remove butter from microwave and stir until completely melted.

Separate eggs, placing yolks in small bowl and setting whites aside for another purpose.

Beat yolks well with whisk or fork, then add to butter and stir well.  Add cream and lemon juice to egg mixture and stir well.  Microwave mixture, uncovered, on high, until just slightly thick, about 1 to 2 minutes, stopping every 20 seconds to stir with fork.

Remove sauce from microwave and stir in mustard.  Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

Note:  This sauce may be kept warm in a Thermos container up to 4 hours.  Or you can cool the sauce to room temperature and refrigerate it in a covered microwave-safe container for up to 24 hours.  To re-warm, cover the container with plastic wrap, pierce wrap with a knife to vent, and microwave on 50% power until heated through, about 3 to 4 minutes, stopping to stir halfway through.  Do not allow sauce to boil.


Note:  I haven't tried the above Hollandaise recipe.  I use the recipe under "sauces."
Description: This casserole tastes like Eggs Benedict without the last minute fuss.
Name: Eggs Benedict Casserole

Description: Rich mashed potatoes for special occasions.
Instructions:
In a large sauce pan in 1 inch water cook potatoes with salt and garlic, tightly covered, 15 to 20 minutes or until tender.  Meanwhile, in skillet, saute mushrooms in 2 tablespoons butter.  Set aside.

When potatoes are tender, discard garlic.  With electric mixer on medium high speed, beat potatoes until fluffy.  Add remaining 1/3 cup butter, egg yolks, and half and half cream.  Beat until well blended.  Fold in mushrooms and parsely.  Pile into ovenproof serving dish.  Sprinkle with paprika.   

Makes 10 servings

Note:  Can be prepared early in the day.  Refrigerate covered.  To serve, bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes until heated through.

Note:  Especially good baked uncovered - like twice baked potatoes.
Name: Elegant Potatoes

Instructions:
1.  Heat butter, sugar, water, and corn syrup in 3 qt. heavy sauce pan over med. heat, stirring occasionally, to boiling.
2.  Increase heat to med. high;  cook without stirring until candy thermometer registers 250 degrees (hard ball stage), about 45 min.
3.  Cook, stirring constantly, until thermometer registers 300 degrees (hard crack stage).
4.  Pour into greased 9x9x2 baking pan.  Cool.
5.  Remove from pan.  Spread top of candy with chocolate;  sprinkle with almonds;  press surface lightly.  Cool.
6.  Break into pieces.

Toffee can be stored in airtight container in refrigerator for 3 months.
Name: English Toffee
Fiesta Pork Chops
Instructions:
Toss onion in flour.  Add tomato and picante sauces, cumin, salt, and oregano.

Place meat in a single layer in a shallow dish.  Pour sauce over meat.  Cover, refrigerate 4 hours or overnight.

Transfer meat and sauce to a large skillet.  Cover, simmer until meat is tender, 25 to 35 minutes.

Remove meat from skillet;  arrange on a serving platter.  Skim fat from skillet; cook and stir sauce about 1 minute to thicken, if necessary.  Pour sauce over meat.  Garnish serving platter with radishes and/or avocado and serve with additional picante sauce.

Ingredients.Name: Pork Chops (Well Trimmed, Cut 1/2 to 3/4 inches thick)

Instructions:
1.  Combine flour and salt in medium bowl.  Cut in shortening until mixture is the size of small peas.  

2.  Sprinkle water, 1 tablespoon at a time, over flour mixture, tossing lightly with a fork until mixture cleans sides of bowl.

3.  Pat dough into a ball.  Refrigerate, wrapped in plastic, 1 hour.

4.  Roll out and place in pie pan.


Note:  Handle pastry as little as possible.  Before rolling out - dough may be frozen, wrapped in plastic, for several weeks.
Description: Makes one 9" pie crust.
Name: Flaky Pie Crust

Instructions:
Brown beef in sauce pan.  Drain excess fat.  Stir in spaghetti sauce mix and tomato sauce.  Add cheeses gradually.  Stir over low heat until cheese melts.

In bowl, blend cornstarch and wine, then add to cheese mixture.  Cook and stir until thick and bubbly.  Transfer to fondue pot.

Cut up Italian bread and dip into fondue.
Name: Fondue Italiano

Ingredients.Name: Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels ( I use 2 semi sweet and 1 milk chocolate)

Name: Foolproof Chocolate Fudge
Instructions: In heavy sauce pan, over low heat, melt morsels with Eagle Brand (or in microwave being careful to check and stir often).  Remove from heat;  stir in remaining ingredients.  Spread evenly into wax paper lined 8 inch square pan.  Chill 2 to 3 hours or until firm.  Turn fudge onto cutting board;  peel off paper and cut into squares.  Store loosely covered at room temperature or covered in refrigerater.

Name: French Bread Crisps
Instructions:
Dip one side of bread slices in butter and place on cookie sheets, butter side up, until entire loaf has been dipped.

Sprinkle with garlic salt and Italian seanoning to taste.

Bake at 250 degrees for 1 hour.  Turn the oven off and leave in the oven one more hour.

Note:

1.  You can also spread the bread with butter as you would a sandwich.

2.  You can use garlic butter or olive oil, too.

3.  Use spices of your choice:  garlic powder, onion powder, white pepper, salt, fennel, tarragon, oregano, etc. are examples.


Note:  Slices should be quite thin - about 1/4 inch.

Cream together the first 3 ingredients.  Add the flour, salt, baking powder, milk, and 2 teaspoons vanilla.

Pour into a 9" x 13" cake pan.  Top with the fresh berries.  Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.  Cool 15 minutes.

To make the frosting, combine 2 teaspoons butter, powdered sugar, milk, and 1 teaspoon vanilla.  Frost cake.
Description: An excellent coffee cake that everyone will enjoy.
Name: Fresh Berry Coffee Cake
Fresh Fruit with Grand Marnier
Instructions: Mix together the first 4 ingredients.  Add your choice of fruit and toss well to coat.  You may use 6 cups of any fruit in season, but some canned fruits may be used, too.

Partially freeze pork.  Thinly slice across the grain into bite-size strips;  set aside.

In a large skillet or wok cook bacon until crisp.  Drain bacon, reserving 3 tablespoons drippings;  crumble bacon on paper toweling.

Cook eggs in 1 tablespoon hot drippings for 2 minutes or until set;  remove and set aside.

Add 1 tablespoon drippings to skillet.  Stir-fry half of the pork till browned;  remove.  Stir-fry remaining pork;  remove.  Add the remaining drippings to skillet;  stir-fry mushrooms and onion 1 minute or until tender.  Stir in bacon, egg, pork and rice;  cook 2 minutes, stirring gently.  Pour soy sauce over pork-rice mixture;  cook 3 minutes more or until heated through.  Serve.

Note:  I add freshly minced garlic, too.
Name: Fried Rice with Pork

Instructions:
Mix dry ingredients and nuts.  Add egg, buttermilk, melted butter, chocolate, and vanilla.  Drop by spoonfuls on buttered cookie sheet.  

Bake in moderate oven at 350 degrees.

Frost with vanilla frosting.
Description: Chocolate cookies with frosting.
Name: Frosted Chocolate Creams

Instructions:
Mix first 4 ingredients like a pie crust.  

Mix remaining ingredients together and add to the above dough mixture.

Put dough in the refrigerator until needed or freeze 1 hour.  Divide dough into 3 parts.  Roll into 1/4 inch thick rectangle.  Sprinkle with desired filling.  Fold over in thirds, tucking ends in after first fold.  Let rise, seam side down, on baking sheet until light.  Bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.

Filling:  Dot with butter and sprinkle with sugar, cinnamon, chopped pecans, raisins or currants.

OR

Beat the three egg whites adding 1/2 cup sugar.  Smooth this on dough before adding nuts and raisins and folding in thirds

Frost with almond flavored white butter frosting.
Name: Frozen Kranz
German Apple Pancake
Description: Great for any meal.
Instructions:
Beat together all of the ingredients.  Bake in a large buttered clay pot or cast iron pan at 450 degrees for 15 minutes.  Reduce temperature to 350 degrees and bake 10 minutes more.

Top with cooked, cut up apples mixed with cinnamon and sugar to taste.  Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

1.  Cream margarine (or butter).  Add sugar and continue creaming.  Add beaten egg and molasses.  Beat well.

2.  Sift flour, baking soda, ginger, and salt together.  Add to above mixture.  Mix well.

3.  Shape into balls and roll in sugar.  Place 3 inches apart on lightly greased baking sheet.

4.  Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes.
Name: Ginger Snaps

Instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a 1 quart microproof measuring dish.  Microwave on medium high power 2 minutes, stirring once.

Makes 3/4 cup sauce.
Name: Gramma's Hot Fudge Sauce
Description: Yummy!
A wonderful chicken dish that makes cooking it the second time super easy.

Ingredients.Name: Black Olives (Sliced)  Note: I Use More

Name: Greek Chicken Over Orzo
Instructions:
Place orzo into already boiling unsalted water and cook according to package directions, about 7 to 8 minutes.  Place Chunky Seasoned Chicken in skillet over medium heat.  Add tomatoes and tomato sauce.  Drain artichoke hearts and add them to skillet.  (If your artichoke hearts are whole or in big pieces, coarsely chop them first.)  Drain olives and add them to skillet.  Add oregano and basil, and stir in.

Raise heat to medium high and bring mixture to boil, stirring from time to time.  Reduce heat to low and simmer until orzo is cooked.  Drain orzo.  Serve chicken at once over a bed of hot orzo.  Garnish each serving with 1 tablespoon feta cheese.  Makes 4 servings.

Chunky Seasoned Chicken Recipe

2  Teaspoons Olive Oil
2  Large Onions (2 Cups Coarsely Chopped)
2 1/2  lbs. Chicken Breasts (Boneless, Skinless)
1  Tablespoon Bottled Minced Garlic (I use fresh)
1  Tablespoon Worcestershire Sauce 

Pour oil into extra deep, 12 inch non-stick skillet and place over medium heat.  Peel and coarsely chop onions, adding them to skillet as you chop.  Cook, stirring from time to time.

Cut all of chicken into bite-size pieces.  When chicken is cut, add it to pan and raise heat to high.  Cook, stirring constantly until chicken is cooked through, about 5 to 6 minutes.  Add garlic and Worcestershire sauce.  Stir well and cook for 30 seconds more.  Remove skillet from heat.

Remove half the chicken mixture (including half the juices), about 3 1/2 cups, to freezer container and set aside to cool.  Return pan to heat and proceed with recipe for Greek Chicken over Orzo.  The remaining chicken may be refrigerated for 2 days or frozen for up to one month.
Mash one of the avocados and leave the other two chunky.  Add the rest of the ingredients and mix.  Chill.
Name: Guacamole
Description: A family favorite.

Instructions:
In small saucepan, stir egg yolks and lemon juice briskly with wooden spoon.  Add half the butter; stir over very low heat until butter is melted.

Add remaining butter, stirring briskly until butter is melted and sauce thickens.  (Be sure butter melts slowly as this gives eggs time to cook and thicken the sauce without curdling.)  Serve hot or at room temperature.

Yield:  1 cup


Variations:

Classic Bearnaise Sauce:  (For broiled meat and fish)

Stir in 1 tablespoon minced onion, 1 teaspoon tarragon leaves, 1/2 teaspoon chervil leaves, and 2 tablespoons white wine, or, if desired, 1 tablespoon white wine vinegar. 

Classic Mousseline Sauce:  (For fish, eggs, artichokes, broccoli, cauliflower, and spinach.)

Cool sauce to room temperature.  Just before serving, beat 1/4 cup chilled whipping cream in chilled bowl until stiff;  fold into sauce.

Yield:  About 1 1/2 cups


Note:  I have only made the Hollandaise sauce.
Name: Hollandaise Sauce
Hot Bacon Dressing
Instructions:
Brown bacon and strain off grease, leaving small amount to brown onion.  Add onion and brown.  Add 3 cups water, sugar, vinegar, and bouillon.  Bring to boil.  Gradually stir in combined cornstarch/water mixture.

Reduce heat to simmer and cook 15 minutes or until thickened.  Serve over bed of fresh spinach.

Serves:  6 to 10

Note:  This dressing can also be used as a base for German potato salad.  Mix dressing along with diced green onions and sliced boiled potatoes.
Description: Wonderful served over fresh, baby spinach.

Name: Irish Creme

Ingredients.Name: Sweetened Condensed Milk (You May Use Low Fat)
Eggs (Can Use Egg Substitute Because of Salmonella Worries)

Instructions: Blend all ingredients one minute.  Keep refrigerated in a glass bottle.  Shake well before using.

Name: Lasagna
Instructions:
Cook lasagna according to package directions.  Drain.  In large skillet, combine ground beef, onion, garlic, and Italian sausage.  Drain.  Stir in next 7 ingredients.   Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat;  simmer 20 minutes. 

In medium bowl blend ricotta, egg, parsley, and salt.

Spoon 1 1/2 cups meat sauce into 13x9x2 pan.

Layer 1/3 each:

Lasagna
Remaining Meat Sauce
Ricotta Mixture
Olives
Mozzarella
Parmesan

Repeat layers.

Cover.  Bake in 375 degree oven 25 minutes.

Uncover.  Bake until hot - about 20 minutes longer.

Let stand 10 minutes.


Yield:   8 to 10 servings

Sift together flour and powdered sugar.  Cut in butter until mixture clings together.  Press into 13x9x2 baking pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

Beat together eggs, granulated sugar, and lemon juice.  Sift together 1/4 cup flour and baking powder.  Stir into egg mixture.  Pour over baked crust.

Bake in 350 degree oven for 25 minutes longer (Do not over bake).  Sprinkle with additional powdered sugar.  Cool and cut into bars.
Name: Lemon Bars

Description: Lemongrass marinade for fish or chicken
Name: Lemongrass Marinade
Instructions: Finely grate lemongrass and garlic. Mix ingredients together and marinate meat. Grill.

Name: Lemongrass Soup with Shrimp (Thom Yum Koong)
Instructions:
Lemongrass stock:
Shell and de-vein shrimp. Set shrimp aside. Saute shells in skillet to bring out shrimp flavor. Transfer to a large stockpot filled with 8 cups of water and bring to boil for 20 minutes. Remove and discard shells. Next add lemongrass, galangal, onion, torn kaffir lime leaves, and place soup on high heat an additional 20 minutes. 

Add shrimp, tomato, mushrooms, fish sauce, lime juice, chili paste, and sugar. Return to simmer for 1 minute and serve with garnish (cilantro, scallions, jalapeno).

Taste should be hot, salty, and sour.
Description: An awesome lemongrass soup -- and I don't even like shrimp!

Instructions: Mix ingredients in order given.  Pour into pie shell.  Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes.  Reduce temperature to 350 degrees and continue baking 45 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Name: Libby's Pumpkin Pie

Ingredients.Name: Sour Cream (Or 8 oz. Cream Cheese & 2 Tablespoons Milk)

Name: Lita's Cheesy Corn Casserole
Instructions:
Mix all ingredients with 1 cup of the cheese..  Pour into a 9x13 inch greased casserole.  Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese.

Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until it tests done with a toothpick.

Take any number of boneless pork chops and place in a glass dish.  Sprinkle liberally with soy sauce and garlic powder.  Cover and refrigerate 4 to 6 hours, turning once.

Grill over coals for 6 or 7 minutes each side until they are no longer pink inside.
Name: Marinated Pork Chops
Marinated Steak

Ingredients.Name: Chuck Roast or Round Steak (or a cut of beef of your choice)

Description: A marinade that our whole family likes.  Tasty and easy to make.
Instructions: Combine all ingredients.  Sprinkle roast with tenderizer.  Pierce with fork 1/2 inch apart.  Cover with marinate and marinate overnight.l

Name: Mediterranean Pasta in Minutes
Instructions:
Boil water for pasta in a pasta pot, fitted with a strainer.  Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.  Brown chicken strips until no longer pink - about 3 minutes each side.  Add sun-dried tomatoes and garlic to skillet.  Saute for 2 minutes.  In the meantime, add the fresh pasta to boiling water, cook until al dente, about 5 minutes.

Now add the basil, artichoke hearts, olives and feta cheese to the skillet.  Saute 1 minute then stir in the cream.  Strain the pasta and transfer to a large pasta bowl.  Add the chicken saute to the pasta and toss.  Season with oregano, salt , and pepper before serving.

Serves 4.

Note:  I have substituted black olives and milk in the recipe.  Recipe may need more milk or cream than it calls for.
Spread ground beef in pan. Grate onion into ground beef. Add worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix together thouroughly and make patties. Grill.
Description: Simple but awesome!
Name: Mom's Hamburgers

Description: This is a side dish that is well worth the effort.
Instructions:
Pierce squash through skin in about five places.  Place on paper towel in microwave and cook on high (100% power) 10 minutes or until squash has softened.  Remove and cool until squash is easy to handle.  Cut lengthwise and remove seeds with a spoon.  Remove spaghetti-like strands of squash with a fork and set aside and cover to keep warm.

Meanwhile, in large non-stick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat.  Add a single layer of mushrooms and cook without stirring about 5 minutes or until mushrooms become red-brown on one side.  Stir in onion and garlic;  cook 5 more minutes or until onions are softened.  Add tomatoes, cheese, and olives, cook 3 minutes longer or until mixture is hot and bubbling.  Remove pan from heat and stir in basil.  Reheat squash in the microwave (if necessary) and divide among 4 shallow bowls.  Spoon sauce over squash and garnish with additional freshly chopped basil.  Serve immediately.

Note:  I used ripe olives instead of kalamata olives.  I also used dried basil instead of fresh (1/2 teaspoon to 1 teaspoon - to taste).

Note:  I used regular tomatoes, peeled, and added them just before serving.

Note:  I used regular feta cheese.
Name: Mushroom Primavera With Spaghetti Squash

Instructions:
Brown meat.  Add onion and green pepper.  Simmer until tender.  Add tomato soup and mushrooms.  

Place in casserole dish and bake until it bubbles.  Sprinkle cheese on top.  Bake until melted.

Note:  I add about 1/2 cup salsa to mixture.
Name: Nana's Casserole
Nana's Lebkuchen
Instructions:
1.  Beat eggs until light.  Add sugar gradually and beat.  

2.  Mix flour, cinnamon, nuts, and dates.

3.  Combine mixtures.

4.  Bake in greased jelly roll pan at 325 degrees for 35 minutes.

5.  Mix together powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla.  Frost baked lebkuchen immediately after taking it out of the oven.


Note:  The jelly roll pan must measure

Follow directions on the box.  Bake in 2 bread pans at 325 degrees about 1 hour.

Frosting:

1 1/2 cups powdered sugar
4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice

Poke top of cake with fork and ice it while warm.
Name: Nana's Lemon Loaf Cake

Instructions:
Combine oatmeal and  2 cups boiling water.  Add lard, salt, and molasses.  

When lukewarm, add 1 yeast cake dissolved in 1/4 cup warm water.  Add 5 cups flour and enough more to make a soft dough. 

Let rise and mold into two loaves.  When double in size, bake in 350 to 375 degree oven for about 50 minutes.


Note:  You can substitute butter, oleo, or shortening for the lard.
Name: Nana's Oatmeal Bread
Nana's Oatmeal Cookies
Instructions:
Dip fingers in cold water and pat down.

Bake at 375 degrees.

Name: New Country Pie
Instructions:
Crust

Combine the first 8 ingredients and mix with a fork.  Put in bottom and on sides of 9" pie pan.

Filling

Combine the rest of the ingredients and spoon into meat shell. Cover with foil and bake at 350 degrees  for 25 minutes.  Uncover, top with reserved cheese.  Bake uncovered 10 to 15 minutes.

Note:  You may have to bake this longer.

Name: No-Cook Pizza Sauce

Ingredients.Name: Whole peeled tomatoes, drained with juice reserved

Instructions:
1. Process tomatoes with oil, vinegar, garlic, and oregano in food processor until smooth, about 30 seconds.
2. Transfer mixture to 2 cup liquid measuring cup and add tomato juice until sauce measures 2 cups.
3. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 
Note: Sauce can be refrigerated for up to 1 week or frozen for up to 1 month.
Note: Use with “Skillet Pizza Margherita.”

Name: Onion Roasted Potatoes

Ingredients.Name: Lipton Recipe Secrets Onion or Onion-Mushroom Soup Mix
All-purpose potatoes, cut into large chunks

Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
In large plastic bag or bowl, add all ingredients.  Close bag and shake, or toss in bowl, until potatoes are evenly coated.  Empty potatoes into shallow baking or roasting pan;  discard bag.  Bake, stirring occasionally, 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown.  Garnish, if desired, with chopped fresh parsley.

Makes 8 servings



Note:  I find 1/8 cup of oil is plenty.  I also found that spraying pan with oil prevents the potatoes from sticking.

Put in a jar and shake well.

Serve with Romaine lettuce (or baby spinach) and 1 can mandarin oranges, drained.  Top with slivered almonds.

Note:  

1. You may caramelize the almonds by cooking 1/2 cup almonds in 3 tablespoons sugar until the sugar melts and the almonds are brown.  Spread on a cookie sheet to cool.  Break into little pieces when cool.  Top salad with the nuts.

2.  Optional:  1/3 cup sliced green onions and dried cherries or cranberries.
Name: Orange Flavored Salad Dressing

Description: Oven roasted cauliflower with garlic, olive oil, and lemon juice.
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 500 degrees.
Place cauliflower florets in a roasting pan.  Drizzle olive oil over cauliflower and season with garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.  Place pan in preheated oven and cook 15 minutes, stirring occasionally to ensure even roasting.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle with Parmesan.  Garnish with chives and serve immediately while still warm.

Note:  I mix all of the ingredients together except the cheese and chives before putting them in the roasting pan.  I mince the garlic instead of slicing it and I use more lemon and cheese.
Name: Oven Roasted Cauliflower
Pappy's Brownies
Instructions:
1.  Melt butter over low heat in a small pan with chocolate and vanilla and cool.

2.  Beat sugar, eggs, and salt thoroughly.  Add flour and nuts.

3.  Fold all mixtures together adding chocolate mixture last.

4.  Bake in 8x8 inch pan about 25 to 30 minutes at 325 degrees.

Name: Pasties
Instructions:
Combine the first six ingredients.  Set aside.  

Combine the remaining ingredients as you would a pie crust.  Wrap the dough in foil and chill one hour.

Divide the dough in six equal parts.  Roll each part into an eight inch circle.  Fill each circle with one cup of the filling.  Fold dough over and crimp the edges so that the pastie is sealed.

Bake at 400 degrees for 40 to 50 minutes.

Name: Peawaukee Lake Margaritas
Instructions: Combine the above ingredients and enjoy!

Name: Pecan Shorts
Instructions:
1.  Mix flour, salt, and nuts. 

2.  Cream butter, add sugar gradually and cream until fluffy.  Add vanilla and water.  Mix.  

3.  Add flour mixture gradually and mix.

4.  Chill.  Shape into balls and/or fingers.

5.  Bake on ungreased sheets at 325 degrees about 20 minutes.

6.  While cookies are warm, sprinkle with additional powdered sugar.

Place oil, garlic, and red pepper flakes in large skillet;  cook over medium high heat for 1 minute or until garlic begins to sizzle.  Stir in tomatoes (juice included) and basil.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat;  cook gently for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Add pasta to skillet;  toss gently.  Cover and let stand over low heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until pasta absorbs sauce.  Sprinkle with cheese.
Name: Penne with Spicy Tomato Sauce
Perfect Apple Pie
Instructions:
Heat oven to 425 degrees.

Follow directions on the pie crust box for the 2 crust pie.

In a large bowl, combine all filling ingredients;  mix lightly.  Assemble pie.


Note:  If using a homemade pie crust - follow that recipe for baking etc.

Ingredients.Name: onion fried until golden in oil
chopped fresh coriander or mint leaves

Description: This is the quickest dal to cook. It takes only 20 min. without using a pressure cooker. The pink color of the lentils becomes pale yellow once cooked. The flavor is more subtle than green lentils.
Name: Pink Lentil Curry (Masoor Dal)
Instructions:
Note: BAGHAR and GARNISH sections are different components to the same dish.

Carefully pick over the lentils, discarding discolored ones or any foeign matter. Wash in a sieve under running water. In a heavy saucepan boil the lentils in water with tumeric. When cooked, turn off heat; add salt, lemon juice and garam masala (and mango powder -- optional).

Heat ghee; add cumin seeds. Fry 2 minutes. Turn off heat. Add cayenne and coriander. Stir and pour over the cooked lentils. Mix well. Garnish. 

Serves 6.

Name: Pork Chops Pizzaiola
Instructions:
Season chops with salt and pepper. Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the crushed garlic and stir it around to flavor the oil. Add in the chops and caramelize on both sides, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Remove the chops to a plate and reserve. Stir in the fennel seed, onions, red pepper flakes, and oregano. Reduce the heat and cook for 7 to 8 minutes.

Add the tomato paste, and cook for 1 minute, then add the wine, and cook for another minute. Stir in the stock and combine well. Slide the chops back into the pan, cover and simmer to finish cooking the chops, about 5 to 6 minutes. Arrange the chops and sauce on a serving platter and serve.
Description: Pork Chops Pizzaiola

Ingredients.Name: Fresh Herbs (Mixed, Chopped, such as Chives, Parsley)

Name: Pork Chops with Mustard and Cream
Instructions:
In a skillet large enough to hold the pork chops in a single layer, heat the oil over medium-high heat until it just begins to smoke.  Add the chops and saute until well browned on each side, 4 to 5 minutes per side.  Transfer to a platter and cover to keep warm.

Discard the oil in the skillet, then wipe out the skillet with a paper towel.  Set over medium heat and add the butter.  When it is melted, add the shallots and garlic and saute until aromatic but not browned, about 1 minute.

Remove the skillet from the heat and add the brandy; be careful here, because the brandy may ignite.  Add the cream and mustard to the skillet and return the skillet to the heat, increasing the heat to high.  Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low.  Return the chops to the skillet, along with any accumulated juices, and simmer until the sauce has reduced enough to coat the back of a spoon and the chops are just cooked through, 4 to 5 minutes.  Turn the chops in the sauce once as they cook.

Remove the skillet from the heat and season the chops with the lemon juice and salt and pepper.  Transfer the chops to a serving platter, spoon sauce over them, and serve immediately, sprinkled with the chopped fresh herbs.

Note:  You can substitute milk for the cream.  Also- 1 Cup Light Cream = 14 Tablespoons milk plus 2Tablespoons Butter

Name: Pork Chops with Sour Cream
Instructions: Lightly spread each chop (both sides) with mustard and dip in flour.  Melt butter in large skillet, add chops and brown on each side.  Add broth, salt, pepper and onion; cover and simmer on very low heat until chops are tender, about 1 1/2 hours.  Remove to heated platter and keep warm.  Add sour cream to pan juices and stir until blended and heated through.  Do not allow to boil.  Pour over chops.

Ingredients.Name: Pork Chops (Thick, Trimmed of all Fat)

Description: A family favorite served with rice.  The sauce is great over the rice and the chops!

Name: Potato Casserole
Instructions:
Mix the first 8 ingredients, top with the bread crumbs or corn flakes, and pour the melted butter over all.

Bake in a 9x13 greased baking dish at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Note:  You can add chicken or sausage.

Ingredients.Name: Bread Crumbs or Crushed Corn Flakes

Name: Praline Squash
Instructions:
Place frozen squash in double boiler and thaw.  Add butter, salt, and pepper ( A little brown sugar or a touch of maple syrup tastes good). 

When thawed, add beaten eggs.  Stir.  Turn into casserole.  Sprinkle on topping made of sugar, cinnamon, allspice, butter, and pecans.

Bake at 350 degrees for 1/2 hour.

Can be made ahead and refrigerated.

Name: Punky's Chocolate Dessert
Instructions:
Heat syrup (do not boil).  Add peanut butter and stir to melt.  Cool.

Put 1/2 ice cream in bottom of 9 x 12 dish.  Cover with 1/2 cool whip.  Drizzle 1/2 cup syrup mixture over it.  Add 1/2 cup peanuts over all.  Repeat layers.

Freeze for 3 1/2 hours.

Name: Quick Mix Spritz
Description: This dough is much easier to work with when pressing butter cookies.
Instructions:
1.  Sift flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder together in a bowl.

2.  With a pastry blender cut butter into dry ingredients until mixture is full of very fine lumps.  It will resemble pie crust or bisquit mix, although not as coarse.

3.  Measure the egg in a measuring cup.  A large egg will measure 1/4 cup.  If it doesn't - add water to the 1/4 cup line.

4.  Add the egg and vanilla and beat the mixture very well.

5.  Form cookies on ungreased sheets with cookie press and bake 10 to 12 minutes at 375 degrees.

1. Bring quinoa and water to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until tender and water has been absorbed, 10 to 15 minutes. Set aside to cool.

2. Whisk together in a bowl the olive oil, lime juice, cumin, and red pepper flakes.

3. Combine quinoa, tomatoes, black beans, and green onions together in a large bowl.
 
4. Pour dressing over quinoa mixture; toss to coat. Stir in cilantro. Season with salt and pepper.

5. Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator.
Name: Quinoa Salad
Reese's Cookies
Instructions:
Cream shortening or butter, sugar, brown sugar, and add vanilla.  Cream until light and fluffy.

Add eggs, beat well.  Combine flour and baking soda; blend into creamed mixture.

Stir in chips.

Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes.

Description: Very good.  A nice change from plain rice.
Name: Rice Pilaf
Instructions:
1.  Melt 3 tablespoons butter in large skillet.  Add pecans and saute 10 minutes, or until lightly browned.  Remove pecans; cover and set aside.

2.  In same skillet, melt remaining butter.  Add onion and saute until tender.  Add rice and stir to thoroughly coat grains.  Add chicken broth, salt, thyme, and pepper.

3.  Cover and simmer 18 to 20 minutes until rice is tender and all liquid is absorbed.

4.  Can be made ahead to this point.  Cover and refrigerate up to 24 hours.  To heat, add 3/4 cup water to cooked rice in skillet.  Cover and heat 5 to 8 minutes until hot.  Remove from heat.  Stir in nuts and parsley.

Description: A great chicken dish that is a little unusual but great tasting!
Source: Good Morning Am. Cut the Calories Cookbook
Name: Roasted Chicken with Black Bean Sauce

Ingredients.Name: Zucchini  (Medium), Trimmed, Halved Lengthwise, then cut into 1 inch chunks.
Sun Dried Tomatoes  (Diced), not oil pack

Instructions:
1.  Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Coat "9 x 13" pan well with olive oil non stick cooking spray.
 
2.  Arrange chicken and zucchini in baking pan, sprinkle with 1 teaspoon each ground cumin and chili powder, then all the salt and pepper.  Set uncovered in oven and roast until chicken is fully cooked and zucchini is tender, about 30 minutes.

3.  Meanwhile, heat olive oil in medium size heavy skillet over moderately high heat until ripples appear on pan bottom - 11/2 to 2 minutes.  Add onion and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 3 minutes.  Sprinkle in remaining 1/2 teaspoon each ground cumin and chili powder, tossing lightly to mix.

4.  Add red wine and boil uncovered until reduced by half - 2 to 3 minutes.  Add canned tomatoes and sun dried tomatoes, reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered until flavors merge - 2 to 3 minutes.  Mix in black beans, cover, and simmer sauce over low heat 5 minutes.  Keep warm until ready to serve.

5.To serve, divide black bean sauce among four heated dinner plates, then arrange chicken and zucchini artfully on top.

Note:  You can substitute mushrooms, asparagus tips, or whatever seasonal vegetable you like.

Name: Sage Dressing
Source: Food Network / Cheryl and Bill Jamison
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.

Toast the bread cubes on baking sheets for about 25 minutes, stirring once or twice, until lightly brown and crisp.  Transfer them to a large bowl.

Butter a 9x13 inch baking dish and set aside.

Brush the leeks and mushrooms with oil and grill over medium heat until tender.  Slice the white and pale green part of the leek and add them along with the mushrooms to the croutons.  Warm 6 tablespoons of butter in a skillet and stir in the celery.  Saute until soft, about 7 minutes.  Add the sage, thyme, salt, and pepper.  Stir to combine and scrape into the bowl of croutons.  Add the stock 1 cup at a time until the bread is very moist but not soupy.  Cover and refrigerate the dressing until ready to use.

Turn the oven up to 425 degrees F.

Taste and adjust the seasoning of the dressing.  Whisk the eggs and baking powder together and incorporate into the dressing.  Spoon the dressing into the prepared baking dish and cover.  Transfer to the oven and bake for 25 minutes.  Uncover and continue baking 15 to 20 additional minutes, or until lightly browned and crusty on top.

Garnish with the herb sprigs and serve the dressing hot.


Note:  I used Breadsmith French bread and I eliminated the mushrooms.

Note:  I used fresh dried sage and dried thyme at the lower amounts called for.

Note:  I didn't grill the leeks .  I sauted them.

Ingredients.Name: Dense Country White Bread Cut into 3/4 inch cubes.
Unsalted Butter Plus More for Greasing the Baking Dish
Dried Thyme or Marjoram (Or a Combination of Both)
Fresh Sage or Thyme Sprigs for Garnish

Description: A very good dressing that is far better than the packaged ones with not much more effort.

Instructions:
Heat oven to 275 degrees.  Cover a baking sheet with heavy brown paper (shopping bag works).

Beat egg whites and cream of tartar until foamy.  Beat in sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time.  Continue beating until stiff and glossy.  Do not under beat!

Drop meringue by 1/3 cupfuls onto brown paper.  Shape mounds into circles, building up sides.  

Bake 1 hour.  Turn off oven.  Leave meringues in oven with door closed, 1 1/2 hours.  Remove from oven.  Finish cooling meringues away from draft.
Description: Easy and fun to make!
Name: Schaum Torte Shells
Scotcheroos
Description: Better than normal Rice Krispies treats - has chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, peanut butter...Easy to make.
Instructions: Combine corn syrup, sugar, peanut butter in saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring constantly.  Pour over Rice Krispies (mix until well blended).  Transfer mixture to 9x13 (greased) pan.  Melt chocolate and butterscotch chips together, and spread on top.

In a large bowl, layer the ingredients in the order listed ending with the Romano and parmesan cheese.  Cover tightly and chill over night.

Just before serving, put crumbled bacon, tomato wedges, and sliced hard cooked eggs on top.
Description: A do ahead salad that everyone enjoys.
Name: Seven Layer Salad
Skillet Pizza Margherita
Instructions:
1. Adjust oven rack to upper-middle position and heat oven to 500 degrees. Grease 12” cast-iron skillet with 2 tablespoons oil.
2. Place dough on lightly floured counter, divide in half, cover with greased plastic wrap. Press and roll 1 piece of dough (keeping remaining dough covered) into 11” round. Transfer dough to prepared skillet and gently push it to corners of pan. Spread 1/2 cup sauce over surface of dough, leaving 1/2” border around edge. Top with half of mozzarella.
3. Set skillet over medium-high heat and cook until outside edge of dough is set, Pizza is lightly puffed, and bottom crust is spotty brown when gently lifted with spatula, 2 to 4 min. Transfer skillet to oven and bake until edge of pizza is golden brown and cheese is melted, 7 to 10 min.
4. Using potholders, remove skillet from oven and slide pizza onto wire rack using spatula; let cool slightly. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon basil, cut into wedges, and serve. Repeat with saved dough.
Note: 1 pizza not enough for 2 people.

Name: Skillet Pork Medallions in Mushroom Marsala Sauce
Description: Easy to make and delicious.  Can also be used with beef and chicken.
Instructions:
1. Trim the tenderloins of silverskin and any excess fat. cut the tenderloins into medallions about 1 1/2 inches thick.  Place medallions with the cut side up and press down with the palm of your hand to flatten slightly. Season the meat with salt and pepper.
2. Heat 3 T oil and 1 T butter in a large skillet over high heat, somewhere between medium-high and high. You want a really hot pan, but not so hot that it will scorch.  When the butter is melted and foaming, add the meat and sear until browned, 2 to 3 minutes.  Don't over-crowd the pan.  Do in two batches, if necessary. Flip and cook the other side until the meat is well browned and slightly firm to the touch, about another 2 minutes. Transfer the pork to a plate. 3. Melt the remaining 2 T butter in the pan.  Add the shallots and a pinch of salt and cook, stirring for about 30 seconds, using a wooden spoon to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan.  Add the mushrooms and cook until all of the mushroom liquid has evaporated and the mushrooms are golden, about 3 minutes.  Sprinkle with the flour and add the Marsala.  Allow the Marsala to boil until almost completely evaporated.
4.  Once the Marsala has almost completely evaporated, add the chicken broth and cook until the mixture is reduced by half, about 3 minutes.  Stir in the cream and parsley.  Return the pork and any accumulated juices to the pan, and cook, flipping the pork once, until it is firm to the touch and still a little pink in the middle, 2 to 4 minutes.  Taste for salt and pepper and serve.  Serve garnished with additional parsley.

Ingredients.Name: Kosher Salt and Freshly Ground Pepper
Shallots Finely Diced (Can substitute Red Onions)
Cremini Mushrooms Thinly Sliced(Or Regular Button Mushrooms)
Chopped Fresh Flat-Leaf Parsely (Plus More For Garnish)

Description: A sloppy Joe recipe with a little zip.
Name: Sloppy Joes
Instructions: Brown hamburger and add rest of ingredients.  Simmer 30 minutes.  (Add water if necessary for right consistency).

Name: Southwestern Lasagna
Instructions:
In a large skillet brown beef and onion.  Drain.  Stir in enchilada sauce, tomatoes, olives, salt, garlic, and pepper.  Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer uncovered, 20 minutes.  In a small bowl, mix cottage cheese and egg.  Set aside.  

Spread 1/3 meat sauce in a greased 9" x 13" baking dish.  Top with 1/2 the Jack cheese, 1/2 the cottage cheese mixture, and 1/2 the tortillas.  Repeat layers ending with meat sauce.  Sprinkle with cheddar cheese.  Cover and bake 20 minutes at 350 degrees.  Uncover and bake 10 minutes longer. 

Serves:  6 - 8
Description: A nice change from classic lasagna.

Name: Spaghetti Pie
Instructions:
Crust:  Break spaghetti in half and place in 2 qt. microproof casserole with hot water, oil, and salt.  Microwave, uncovered, on high power, 14 minutes, or until tender.  Drain; rinse with hot water and mix with margarine, eggs, and cheese.  Lightly grease a 10 inch microproof pie plate.  Form spaghetti mixture into crust.  Cover with vented plastic wrap - microwave on med. power (50%) 5 to 6 minutes until crust is just set, turning dish halfway through.

Filling:  Brown meat with onion and green pepper.  Add tomatoes, tomato paste, flour, garlic, sugar, oregano, and salt.

Spread cottage cheese over bottom of cooked crust.  Add meat mixture.  Microwave covered - med. power (50%) until heated.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Let stand 5 minutes.

Combine spaghetti, eggs, parmesan cheese, and parsley.  Layer 1/2 of spaghetti mixture and mozzarella cheese in greased 9" pie plate.  Repeat layers.  Bake at 350 degrees  12 minutes.

Combine tomato paste, water, mushrooms, butter, and seasonings;  simmer 10 minutes.  Cut pie into weges;  serve with sauce.  Sprinkle with additional parmesan cheese, if desired.
Name: Spaghetti Pie Italiano

Instructions:
Saute onions, green pepper, and garlic in oil until golden, stirring often.  Stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, parsley, oregano, salt, and bay leaf.  Simmer uncovered for 20 minutes.    Cook noodles according to package directions and drain.

Combine spinach, ricotta, egg, and 1/4 cup parmesan, salt, and pepper.

Order of Layers:

1.  Spoon 1/3 of tomato sauce in bottom of pan.
     Layer 1/3 of Lasagna Noodles
     1/2  Spinach - Ricotta mixture
     1/2  Mozzarella
     1/2  Parmesan

2.  Repeat layers using
    1/2  Remaining Sauce
    1/2  Remaining Noodles
     All  Remaining Filling

3.  Top with remaining noodles, sauce, parmesan, and         mozzarella.


Bake at 350 degrees covered 45 minutes.  Uncover and bake 20 minutes more.  Let stand before serving.


Note:

1.  Use 3 lasagna noodles per layer = 9 noodles.
2.  Use Asiago instead of parmesan (or both) liberally.
3.  Use 1 1/2 lbs. mozzarella
Name: Spinach Lasagna

Description: A taco recipe that is more than just ground beef in a flour tortilla.  It includes tomato sauce and spices.
Name: Tacos
Instructions:
Brown ground beef.  Add onion.  Add rest of ingredients and simmer for 20 minutes.

Note:  I add some salsa to the mixture to give it a little zip.

Name: Tomato Meat Sauce
Description: A great tomato sauce for spaghetti.
Instructions: In a large frying pan, fry the ground chuck and onion until cooked through.  Add the rest of the ingredients.

Name: Tuna Casserole
Instructions: Mix together all ingredients and 1/2 can onion rings.  Bake at 350 degrees for 1/2 hour.  Sprinkle rest of onion rings on top the last 5 minutes.

Drain broccoli and arrange it in a baking dish.  Cover with the prosciutto, then with the turkey.

In separate saucepan melt butter and blend in flour.  Stir in the chicken stock and cream;  cook, stirring constantly, until sauce is smooth and thick.  Stir in 2 tablespoons each Parmesan and Swiss cheese, sherry, salt, and cayenne.  Heat just until cheese is melted.  Pour sauce over turkey;  sprinkle with the 1/4 cup grated Parmesan.  

Bake at 350 degrees until the sauce is hot and the cheese brown and bubbly, about 30 minutes.

Note:  I use more of both cheeses in sauce.  Use Kraft Parmesan cheese rather than freshly grated for more flavor.
Name: Turkey Mornay
Turkish Ravioli
Description: Turkish Ravioli recipe from one of Paige's games

Name: Veal Parmesan
Instructions:
Skin sausage and cut into small pieces.  Fry slowly until brown and free of fat.  Drain fat from skillet.  Combine the first 8 ingredients and cook slowly, covered for 30 minutes. (Sauce can be made day ahead).

Bread and fast fry veal until golden brown.  Place in a large baking pan.  Season meat well.  Cover each steak with a slice of mozzarella cheese; spoon sauce over cheese and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 45 minutes.

Ingredients.Name: Veal (Thinly Sliced) I Use Veal Cutlets
Marsala Wine (Dry) I Use a Sweet Marsala

Name: Veal Scaloppine Bolognese
Instructions: Sprinkle veal with Parmesan cheese and pound thin. (Pounding isn't necessary with veal cutlets).  Saute mushrooms in butter and remove from pan.  Salt.  Add wine and bouillon to the pan drippings.  Scrape loose all the brown particles and bring to a boil.  Blend 1 Tbsp. flour into gravy and simmer to thicken.  Return veal and mushrooms and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until veal is tender.

Over moderate heat, add oil to a deep pot and combine onion, peppers, and garlic.  Saute for 3 to 5 minutes to soften vegetables.  Deglaze pan with beer or broth, add tomotoes, black beans, red kidney beans, and stir to combine.

Season chili with cumin, chili powder, hot sauce, and salt.  Thicken chili by stirring in refried beans.  Simmer over low heat abut 5 to 10 minutes longer, then serve up bowls of chili and top with shredded cheese, scallions, and tomatoes.  Place bowls on charger plates piled with assorted tortilla chips.

Toppings

8 oz. (2 cups shredded) spicy monterey jack or smoked cheddar.
Chopped scallions, whites and greens
Diced fresh seeded plum tomato
Blue & Red corn tortilla chops or black bean tortilla chips, for dipping

Note: 
I used beer
Try using less crushed tomato - maybe 1/2          crushed and 1/2 diced.
I used 1 1/2 teaspoons cumin
I used 1 tablespoon chili powder
I did not use red kidney beans.  1 can of black beans was enough
Name: Veg-Head Three Bean Chili

Ingredients.Name: Bell Pepper (Red or Green, Seeded, & chopped)

Description: Good (even with the oyster sauce) vietnamese style egg rolls.
Name: Vietnamese Egg Rolls
Instructions:
Note: The soup spoons used in the amounts above are Asian soup spoons -- which hold quite a bit more than Western soup spoons. Go to a chinese restaurant to see what I'm talking about .

1. Heat water almost to boiling in large bowl. This will be used to wet rice paper when making rolls.
2. Put ground pork in big mixing bowl.
3. Boil bean thread, strain, cut into manageable lengths, add to bowl.
4. Soak black fungus in boiling water, strain, cut into manageable lengths, add to bowl.
5. Chop onions and green onions (2/3 the way up), add to bowl.
6. Add oyster sauce, pepper, sugar, salt, cornstarch mixture, eggs.
7. Knead mixture in bowl until even.
8. Wet the rice paper in the hot water (from step 1). Once it becomes pliable but not too sticky, fold 1/3 of paper down. This gives the roll a thicker area to spread the meat mixture on.
9. Place meat mixture on folded rice paper, spread so that there is 1 inch of space on each of the ends. 
10. Fold the ends of the rice paper on top of the meat mixture.
11. Roll it up, pulling the roll if necessary to make a firm wrap.
12. Repeat steps 8 through 11 until all rice paper or meat mixture is gone.
13. Poke rolls with toothpick liberally (this prevents them from blowing up in the fryer).
14. Fry rolls in deep fryer at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until fryer is noticeably quieter (the water will have been cooked off � the water is what makes the fryer loud!).

Brown beef.  Add remaining ingredients.  Cover and simmer 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Serve.

Note:  This works well for stuffing green peppers and baking them.
Name: Western Hash
Wheat & White Bread
Instructions:
Dissolve yeast in very warm water.  Add a little of the brown sugar to aid the yeast.  After it starts to bubble, add the rest of the brown sugar, salt, butter and 2 1/4 cups warm water.  Stir in the whole wheat flour and beat until smooth.  Add bread flour 1 cup at a time, mixing well with each addition.  Continue to add flour until dough leaves the side of the bowl almost clean.  Knead dough on lightly floured surface about 10 minutes. Place in greased bowl and turn greased side up. Cover and let rise about 1 hour in warm place.  Punch down dough and divide in half.  Roll each half into a 9" x 18" rectangle.  Roll up from long end and seal edges, folding under ends.  Place seam side down in greased loaf pan ( 9" x 5" ), butter tops, cover, and let rise until double - about 1 hour. 

 Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes.  Remove from pans and cool on wire racks.

Note:  If dough doesn't rise high enough before baking, start the loaves in a cold oven.  The fast warming oven will force-rise the dough.

Name: Wheat 'N White Dinner Rolls
Instructions:
In large bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  Stir in sugar, salt, butter, eggs and potatoes.  Mix in flours by hand until dough is easy to handle.  Turn onto lightly floured board and knead until smooth and elastic.  Place in greased bowl.  Grease top of dough, cover with a damp cloth and put in refrigerator.  About 2 hours before baking, shape dough into rolls.  Cover and let rise until double, about 1 1/2  to 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees and bake 12 to 15 minutes.  Makes 4 dozen.

You can keep dough refrigerated for up to three days.

Name: Wild Rice Casserole
Instructions: Soak wild rice at least 8 hours.  Mix ingredients together in greased casserole dish.  Cover and bake at 350 degrees for one hour.
